entry.title: Deadline Approaching for Local Educator Grant Applications
entry.summary: 12/29/2023 9:30 a.m. The deadline is approaching for educators in Douglas County to apply for grants through the Fund for Teachers. Officials with the Roseburg Public School District said this is a chance for educators to enhance their teaching journey through grants of up to $5,000 for individuals, and up to $10,000 for teams. entry.title: Wildlife Safari Seeking Year End Gifts
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 6:25 a.m. Wildlife Safari kicked off three new projects this year and is seeking year end donations. The projects are: *The Barnyard: a renovation of the children’s zoo *The Rhino Boma Project *The Giraffe Squeeze The Barnyard project will allow for hands-on interaction with children’s zoo animals, including friendly goats and sheep....

entry.title: Winston City Council Meeting Canceled
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 6:25 a.m. Due to a lack of business items, Wednesday’s meeting of the Winston City Council has been canceled. Winston city offices will be closed on Monday. They will close again on January 15th for the Martin Luther King Jr. holiday. For more information about the City of Winston, go to: https://winstoncity.org/

entry.title: County Government to Close on Monday For New Years
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 6:20 a.m. Douglas County government offices will be closed on Monday for New Year’s Day. A County release said that includes the courthouse, Justice Building, county annex in Reedsport, transfer stations, fairgrounds and all external county government offices. The Umpqua River Lighthouse Museum in Winchester Bay will be open on Monday for...

entry.title: Winter Break at the Library Concludes Saturday
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 2023 6:20 a.m. Winter Break at the Library concludes Saturday, presented by Friends of the Myrtle Creek Library. Activities take place from 12:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. both days. On Friday, it’s a Movie Day, with Read-to-a-Dog happening on Saturday. The library is a 231 Northeast Division Street in Myrtle Creek. For more...

entry.title: Festival of Lights Wraps Up Sunday Night
entry.summary: Dec. 29, 20023 6:20 a.m. The Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights at River Forks Park wraps up Sunday night. Presented by the Roseburg Rotary Club, it features over 90 displays and more than 500,000 lights. Tickets are $10 per vehicle. They can be obtained at the event or online. Started in 1993, proceeds from the...

entry.title: William 'Andrew' Ernst promoted as Roseburg UScellular store manager
entry.summary: William “Andrew” Ernst has years of sales and managing experience at UScellular — the fourth-largest full-service wireless carrier in the United States — and now he’s been promoted to store manager for Roseburg’s location at 780 NW Garden Valley Blvd.

entry.title: Douglas County employers add 60 jobs in November
entry.summary: Douglas County payroll employment increased a seasonally adjusted 60 jobs in November after a decrease of 240 in October and an increase of 70 in September.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 1 Tyee Ridge Fire
entry.summary: The Tyee Ridge Complex fire burned nearly 8,000 acres of land west of Roseburg after an August lightning storm struck the country side over 100 times, starting multiple fires.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 5 shooting hoax
entry.summary: Chaos erupted on the morning of Feb. 21, when active shooter calls rang out from schools across the county.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 6 Roseburg addresses homelessness
entry.summary: After more than a year in the works, the city of Roseburg opened the indoor section of the Gary Leif Navigation Center in September, providing an additional 30 beds for the homeless.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 7 school bonds fail
entry.summary: Roseburg and Oakland schools tried to get voter approval and tax dollars to make some much needed repairs to their aging school buildings.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 8 Deputy fired from DCSO
entry.summary: Mason Goodknight was discharged from his position as a Douglas County Sheriff’s Office corrections deputy on April 4 for refusing to follow the transgender policy at the jail.

entry.title: 2023 top stories: honorable mention: New medical leaders in Roseburg
entry.summary: Patrick Hull — Roseburg VA Director

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 3 Archie Creek settlements
entry.summary: Utility company PacifiCorp, parent company of Pacific Power, reached a $299 million settlement with 463 individual plaintiffs on Dec. 5, for lawsuits related to the Archie Creek Complex Fire. On Dec. 15, PacifiCorp settled at $250 million with 10 companies…

entry.title: 2023 top stories: No. 4 WinCo Foods opens in Roseburg
entry.summary: WinCo Foods opened its doors in Roseburg just ahead of schedule on Nov. 6 as a long line formed outside the company’s 140th location.

entry.title: NeighborWorks Umpqua receives grant to assist veterans
entry.summary: NeighborWorks Umpqua received a $44,160 Veteran Services Grant from the Oregon Department of Veterans’ Affairs for projects and services focusing on veterans.
